name: isnrg
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

stmt.pretty: elrab2(hs0, c0, cnrg, cngp, c1 ∈ c2, (norm ` hs0)∈(AbsVal ` hs0))

body.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, cnrg), wa(wcel(c0, cngp), wcel(c1, c2)))

-| diffsc(hs0, c0)
-| diffsc(hs0, cngp)
-| diffsw(hs0, wcel(c1, c2))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ NrmRing ↔(c0 ∈ NrmGrp ∧ c1 ∈ c2))
⊣ (hs0 = c0 →((norm ` hs0)∈(AbsVal ` hs0)↔ c1 ∈ c2))
⊣ NrmRing = { hs0 ∈ NrmGrp |(norm ` hs0)∈(AbsVal ` hs0)}
⊣ d(hs0, c0)
⊣ d(hs0, NrmGrp)
⊣ d(hs0, c1 ∈ c2)

comment: A normed ring is a ring with a norm that makes it into a normed group, and such that the norm is an absolute value on the ring. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Oct-2015.)
